intro: Lomatium daucifolium, commonly known as the Pacific silverweed, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant ecosystems.
